intro: Serratula attica, commonly known as the Greek toothache plant, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and wastelands. Serratula attica has serrated leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It is sometimes used in traditional medicine, though its toxicity requires caution in use.
